image.altText: A pipe bomb outside on the ground

props.synopsis: Police are urging Canberrans not to touch suspicious objects after pipe bombs were discovered in Belconnen.

title.children: 'Dangerous' pipe bombs found on Canberra footpaths

image.altText: A colourful children's toy block lies sideways in front of a colourful abacus.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

title.children: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry

image.altText: A yellow and purple car impounded by police.

props.synopsis: A major police operation at Summernats has resulted in 19 vehicle seizures, hundreds of traffic offences and multiple arrests.

title.children: Police seize 19 vehicles after dangerous driving at Summernats

image.altText: A motion-sensor camera image of a koala.

props.synopsis: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

title.children: Camera footage 'giving us hope that koalas might still be around'

image.altText: Woman with bob haircut sits on a purple chair in an empty doctor waiting room.

props.synopsis: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

title.children: Only 1 in 10 ACT GP clinics are bulk billing despite nationwide increase

image.altText: Generic NSW Police blue and white tape

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old man has died after a crash between a car and a truck on the Monaro Highway, south of Canberra.

title.children: ACT records first road fatality of 2026 after crash near Royalla

image.altText: A scientist with a microscope.

props.synopsis: When Queen Elizabeth II used a product on her royal tour of Australia in 1963, journalists noticed. Then everyone wanted to use it.

title.children: The Aussie invention made famous by Queen Elizabeth II

image.altText: A close-up of feet walking on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Two new studies have found that small improvements in day-to-day life can have substantial impacts on life expectancy.

title.children: A few extra minutes of exercise and sleep may help you live a year longer

image.altText: A man in purple t shirt holding a ladder

props.synopsis: Thousands of people present to Australian hospitals each year for ladder and roof falls, with doctors urging caution — particularly for ageing Australians.

title.children: Doctors urge caution as injuries from ladder and roof falls rise

image.altText: Firefighters battling the Ravenswood fire in Moyreisk last week.

props.synopsis: More than 228 homes have been confirmed destroyed by bushfires across Victoria, with authorities warning the total is likely to rise.

title.children: Firefighters gain ground across Victoria as damage toll rises

image.altText: The Washington Post logo on a marble sign out the front of an office building.

props.synopsis: The reporter had previously reported on the Trump administration's efforts to fire hundreds of thousands of federal workers.

title.children: FBI raids home and seizes devices of Washington Post journalist

image.altText: A black and white image shows the Grok image logo which says 'Grok' next to a stylised black box

props.synopsis: New laws in the UK that would outlaw the generation of sexual deepfakes are set to come into force this week.

title.children: X to change AI chatbot after outrage over sexual deepfake images

image.altText: Antarctic expeditioners in the gym and hot tub at Casey Station 2025-11-30 11:11:00

props.synopsis: From 6,000 applications each year, only about 300 make the cut to travel down to Antarctica and experience a workplace like no other.

title.children: Hot tubs, ice and penguins: Life working in Antarctica

image.altText: An image of South Australia Premier Peter Malinauskas speaking.

props.synopsis: After backing the Adelaide Festival’s decision to drop a Palestinian Australian author from Writers’ Week, Premier Peter Malinauskas is now trying to distance himself from a crisis that threatens to do untold damage to South Australia’s festival reputation.

title.children: SA Premier attempts to distance himself from a crisis engulfing 'The Festival State'

image.altText: A close up of a man with black round glasses and short grey hair with green background

props.synopsis: As the Adelaide Festival director reveals he had urged the festival's board not to cancel Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, a former board member opens up about his very different concerns about the Adelaide Writers' Week program.

title.children: Festival director warned board about Writers' Week fallout

image.altText: Kazem Kaz Hamad at what appears to be a boxing ring with two people who's faces are blurred out.

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he believes tobacco kingpin Kaz Hamad thought he was "out of reach" of authorities before his arrest in Iraq.

title.children: Captured tobacco kingpin thought 'he was out of reach', says Burke

image.altText: A woman sitting inside an official building looks on.

props.synopsis: Anti-corruption watchdogs in Ukraine have searched the offices of the country's former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko amid allegations of a major bribery scheme.

title.children: Ukraine's former PM Yulia Tymoshenko facing allegations of bribery

image.altText: A man with grey hair and sunglasses looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Would you face prison for what you believe in? Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi already has and, following the release of his latest film, he may again.

title.children: Why the Iranian government doesn't want you to see this film

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: Gulgong went 18 months without a GP clinic. It has now reopened, giving residents a reprieve from travelling hundreds of kilometres to see a doctor.

title.children: Community's days of driving eight hours for a GP appointment now gone

image.altText: A boy faces a teacher who is standing in front of a blackboard.

props.synopsis: Hackers have accessed the emails, passwords and names of past and present students from all Victorian government schools in a major data breach.

title.children: Hackers access student emails, passwords in major school data breach

image.altText: A limestone bridge structure with two arches carved by sea

props.synopsis: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge rock formation collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

title.children: 'No joke, London Bridge has fallen down': The moment two tourists were trapped by nature

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles widely holding a silver trophy

props.synopsis: Sydneysider Jordan Smith has beaten grand slam champion Jannik Sinner and dual grand slam finalist Amanda Anasimova to take home the prize in the novelty format.

title.children: 'Can't speak': Tennis battler beats the pros to take home $1 million jackpot

image.altText: Dozens of rescue workers stand by a wrecked train carriage

props.synopsis: A crane used to construct an elevated high-speed railway has fallen onto a moving train travelling from Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, officials say.

title.children: At least 32 killed after crane falls on Thai passenger train

image.altText: The wind whips up embers as the Palisades fire burns during a windstorm on the west side of Los Angeles.

props.synopsis: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

title.children: What life was like in 2025 across the planet in a changing climate

image.altText: Electric bikes being crushed by heavy machinery.

props.synopsis: Police charge 25 youths and seize and destroy dozens of electric scooters and off-road bikes in a targeted crackdown on e-rideables in Perth's northern suburbs.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': Juveniles charged, e-rideables crushed in police crackdown

image.altText: Alyssa Healy smiles

props.synopsis: After calling time on her decorated 15-year career, a spell in media commentary looks inevitable for Australian cricket star Alyssa Healy.

title.children: 'She watches a lot more cricket than I do': Healy taken aback by commentary praise

image.altText: Ship near Antarctic ice.

props.synopsis: Australian authorities say they are "investigating all the options available" to assist a search operation for a diver missing in Antarctica.

title.children: Search underway for missing diver in Antarctica

image.altText: A police boat moored at a marina.

props.synopsis: Police search for a boat worth about $140,000 that was stolen from the Sunshine Coast after its keys were left on board while the owners were overseas on holiday.

title.children: Police baffled by 'strange' $140k boat theft

image.altText: Farmer with his dog on a farm, smiling

props.synopsis: Amid the damage from flooding in Central Queensland, tales of livestock surviving are emerging, including one cow's incredible waterlogged journey.

title.children: Cow survives 80km swim in floodwater before washing ashore on beach

image.altText: An Australian Rules Football with the AFL logo on the middle

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man who had "had enough" after becoming the target of "pranks" by kids, had hoarded "hundreds" of footballs kicked into his yard from the neighbouring school, a court hears.

title.children: Man hoarded 'hundreds' of footballs kicked over fence, court hears

image.altText: Poppy crop up close

props.synopsis: The theft of a "significant quantity" of medicinal-grade poppies could result in a "life-threatening" situation if they are ingested in pursuit of a high, Tasmanian authorities warn.

title.children: Poppy thieves warned of 'life-threatening' danger

image.altText: A small boat in the ocean.

props.synopsis: The men will serve four months in prison after being caught off the WA coast with 40 kilograms of sea cucumber and an array of fishing gear.

title.children: Indonesian fishermen jailed after repeat offences in Australian waters

image.altText: A pipe bomb outside on the ground

props.synopsis: Police are urging Canberrans not to touch suspicious objects after pipe bombs were discovered in Belconnen.

title.children: 'Dangerous' pipe bombs found on Canberra footpaths

image.altText: Young man placing a transparent plastic container of food into the microwave.

props.synopsis: Researchers say there are some simple ways to help minimise our exposure to the microplastics and nanoplastics in our homes.

title.children: Air-drying laundry, wooden chopping boards: Reducing exposure to microplastics at home
